Class NewClaimCheckBase

    • populateAdditionalCheckFields

      protected void populateAdditionalCheckFields(Check check)
      Populates additional fields on check after the check is created. The default implementation of this method does nothing but a subclasser can override it to populate additonal fields.
      Parameters:
      check - check to populate values

    • setOverrideExchangeRate

      public void setOverrideExchangeRate(boolean override)
      sets the overrideExchangeRate value and refresh the exchangeRate accordingly. If override is false, reset the exchangeRate to market exchangeRate, else update the description
      Parameters:
      override - boolean to indicate if exchangeRate is to be overriden

    • deductibleExceedsCheckAmount

      @Deprecated public boolean deductibleExceedsCheckAmount()
      Deprecated.
      Split deductibles are now supported. This method now always returns false.
      Determines if Apply Deductible is enabled for this check and, if so, whether the amount on the Check falls short of the Deductible Amount. Since the Deductible(Coverage) Currency and Check's Transaction Currency may not always match, we employ the following logic: - Look at the Check's Transaction and Claim Amounts (in that order) and if either of them has the same Currency as that of the Deductible Amount, use that particular amount to compare against Deductible Amount. - Else, convert the Transaction Amount to Coverage Currency (using current market rate) and then compare it against the Deductible Amount.
      Returns:
      true if Apply Deductible is enabled for this Check and the Deductible Amount exceeds the Check Amount; returns false otherwise
